segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and I feel a sense of disgust at the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but at least they’re not making the mess worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed the puddle forming around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is going to fall, and the girl is just standing there waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like the whole scene is just one big disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets, and the woman is just going to keep drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand how messy everything is, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks nice, but inside, it’s a complete mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to clean this whole place up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is making me feel so uncomfortable.
segments.speaker: PAR
